channel.title: How to create a login code for staff? EX: Owner has logged in!

item.title: How to create a login code for staff? EX: Owner has logged in!
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Tyler") && connectedFrom.equals("192.168.1.101")) { modyell("Server Owner Tyler has logged in!"); }

item.title: How to create a login code for staff? EX: Owner has logged in!
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Take the ‘!’ out. You’re saying "If the login’s name is Tyler, but not connected from that IP, then ‘modyell’.

item.source: How to create a login code for staff? EX: Owner has logged in!

item.title: How to create a login code for staff? EX: Owner has logged in!
item.dc:creator: @Pixel_Cookies Pixel_Cookies
item.description:
@Pixel_Cookies wrote:

Try to search the variable for player rights, and do something usefull with it.

Example:

if (playerRights == 1) {//Mod Login sM ("Mod" + playerName + " Has logged into the server!") }

But than search for your login section in ‘client.java’ and add an ‘Message to all’ function to it.

More Help?
PM ~ Pixel_Cookies

Read full topic

item.title: How to create a login code for staff? EX: Owner has logged in!
item.dc:creator: @frostscapeserver frostscapeserver
item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

Trying to make a code so when I log in, the whole server gets a message.

This is what I’ve got but it doesn’t work-only the second half is right.

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Tyler”) && !connectedFrom.equals(“192.168.1.101”)) {
modyell(“Owner Tyler has logged in!”)

Read full topic
